fields.descriptive_line: Silver-gilt, set with enamelled bosses, Spain or Mexico, ca. 1630, unmarked.
fields.physical_description: Silver-gilt cross on a triangular base, the base decorated with applied enamelled oval plaques and a chased gadrooned border; the stem for the cross a series of cylinders and a vase-shape, decorated with engraved motifs and applied enamelled oval plaques. On one side the cross is silver-gilt decorated with pounced motifs; on the other there are 10 oval niches which alternate with applied oval enamelled plaques (the three niches across the arms of the cross are larger than the rest). The niches are for relics; seven of them are intact and contain a fragment of textile (?red velvet) behind a glass or crystal window. The large central oval in the centre of the cross appears to contain cotton wool and fragments of painted plaster. In the centre on the non-relic side of the cross, the metal has been knocked and distorted on one side.
fields.dimensions: Height: 49 cm, Width: 23 cm maximum, Depth: 21 cm depth of triangular base, Weight: 1491.1 g
fields.marks: No assay mark or other marks on this piece.
fields.bibliography:
Oman, Charles. <u>The Golden Age of Hispanic Silver: 1400-1665</u>. London: Her Majesty's Stationery Office, 1968.
Cat. no. 141.
<u>Antiquitäten und alte Gemälde aus dem Nachlass des verstorbenen Freiherr F. von Stumm</u>. Auction catalogue: Günther Deneke Auktionhaus, Berlin, October 4, 1932.
Sold as lot 327.
fields.history_note: Nothing is known of the early ownership or provenance of this cross. The collector Walter Leo Hildburgh acquired it in Berlin in October 1932, at the sale of the von Stumm collection (lot 327).
